Conducting the test

 

Every new participant must demonstrate that they can safely handle the air rifle before being allowed to fire the air rifle. The test is a review of range commands and actions, and includes assessment of the procedures for:

 

•safe rifle status on the firing point;

•loading, holding, aiming and firing;

•Unloading and prepare for inspection;

•immediate actions and stoppages, and

•correctly responding to the “Cease fire” command.

 

The rifle handling test can be conducted by the RSO immediately before firing, or the RSO can task an Assistant RSO to supervise the test. Novice participants may require training to be successful on the test. Experienced participants should be tested regularly – e.g. before undertaking their first marksmanship training activity of the training year.

 

RSO qualification

 

Part of the RSO qualification process is to pass an air rifle handling test; download the air rifle handling test checklist from the reference section to practice before taking the test.

Air rifle handling test
